cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, skirting the North Carolina coast Monday then curving eastward out into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: no direct landfall; closest coastal approach near the Outer Banks, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (nearest watch/warning area begins at Surf City, NC)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Surf City to Duck, NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Georgia through North Carolina coastlines will experience swells and some fringe rain-bands; primary impacts concentrate along the North Carolina Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Fringe tropical-storm-force gusts are unlikely; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Monday morning as Arthur passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises of 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along exposed Georgia barrier islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate outer-band rain, generally under 1 inch at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby beaches.
